column1: IAEA chief hopes to hold talks with Iranian president by November
column2: Several long-standing issues are straining Iran-IAEA relations, including Tehran's refusal to allow uranium-enrichment experts on inspection teams and its failure to explain uranium traces at undeclared sites
column7: IAEA chief hopes to hold talks with Iranian president by November
column8: Several long-standing issues are straining Iran-IAEA relations, including Tehran's refusal to allow uranium-enrichment experts on inspection teams and its failure to explain uranium traces at undeclared sites

column1: Why Trump and Vance won't condemn Tucker Carlson and his Holocaust-denying pals
column2: At least Donald Trump is consistent. He's been defending antisemites and Holocaust deniers for years. But as the Republican presidential candidate, his proximity to Tucker Carlson constitutes a clear and present danger to the U.S., Israel, and Jews across the globe
column7: Why Trump and Vance won't condemn Tucker Carlson and his Holocaust-denying pals
column8: At least Donald Trump is consistent. He's been defending antisemites and Holocaust deniers for years. But as the Republican presidential candidate, his proximity to Tucker Carlson constitutes a clear and present danger to the U.S., Israel, and Jews across the globe

column1: Fatal attack at the Israel-Jordan border could land King Abdullah in a political minefield
column2: Jordan's king has skillfully balanced the internal anger toward Israel and the effort to maintain diplomatic ties. The attacker's connection to a key supportive tribe complicates matters for him, days before Jordanians are set to vote for a new parliament
column7: Fatal attack at the Israel-Jordan border could land King Abdullah in a political minefield
column8: Jordan's king has skillfully balanced the internal anger toward Israel and the effort to maintain diplomatic ties. The attacker's connection to a key supportive tribe complicates matters for him, days before Jordanians are set to vote for a new parliament

column1: Israeli arrested for publishing threatening video against hostage's mother
column2: Police arrested a man from northern Israel after he allegedly published a video in which he threatens to attack Einav Zangauker, the mother of Matan who has been held in Gaza for over 11 months
column7: Israeli arrested for publishing threatening video against hostage's mother
column8: Police arrested a man from northern Israel after he allegedly published a video in which he threatens to attack Einav Zangauker, the mother of Matan who has been held in Gaza for over 11 months

column1: Defense wounds found on murdered Gaza hostages, Israeli army tells families
column2: The IDF retrieved the hostages' bodies last week, stating that they were executed shortly before the soldiers arrived. According to one of the hostages' relatives, the families were told that the scene in the tunnel was chaotic and that defense wounds were found on the hostages
column7: Defense wounds found on murdered Gaza hostages, Israeli army tells families
column8: The IDF retrieved the hostages' bodies last week, stating that they were executed shortly before the soldiers arrived. According to one of the hostages' relatives, the families were told that the scene in the tunnel was chaotic and that defense wounds were found on the hostages

column1: Guns, braids, and watchful eyes: This Ethiopian Israeli artist refuses to be a cliché
column2: Rachel Anyo seizes control of her narrative, crafting provocative works that confront Black femininity, lurking violence, and societal expectations – and boldly rejects the modesty imposed upon her
column7: Guns, braids, and watchful eyes: This Ethiopian Israeli artist refuses to be a cliché
column8: Rachel Anyo seizes control of her narrative, crafting provocative works that confront Black femininity, lurking violence, and societal expectations – and boldly rejects the modesty imposed upon her

column1: Netanyahu asks court to block airing of his interrogation in upcoming film
column2: A Jerusalem court rejected the petition shortly after it was filed, and hours before 'The Bibi Files' is scheduled to debut at the Toronto Film Festival
column7: Netanyahu asks court to block airing of his interrogation in upcoming film
column8: A Jerusalem court rejected the petition shortly after it was filed, and hours before 'The Bibi Files' is scheduled to debut at the Toronto Film Festival

column1: Report: Israel strikes Iran-affiliated sites in Syria, including chemical weapons facility
column2: Syrian state media says Israel carried out strikes near Hama overnight ■ Opposition war monitor says seven killed
column7: Report: Israel strikes Iran-affiliated sites in Syria, including chemical weapons facility
column8: Syrian state media says Israel carried out strikes near Hama overnight ■ Opposition war monitor says seven killed

column1: All Israelis will pay for justice minister's obsession with the judiciary, maybe even Netanyahu
column2: Having no other choice, Israel's Supreme Court justices have been forced against to order the justice minister to be so kind as to obey the letter of the law and convene the Judicial Appointments Committee, which hasn't met for more than a year, so that it can choose a new Supreme Court president according to the seniority system
column7: All Israelis will pay for justice minister's obsession with the judiciary, maybe even Netanyahu
column8: Having no other choice, Israel's Supreme Court justices have been forced against to order the justice minister to be so kind as to obey the letter of the law and convene the Judicial Appointments Committee, which hasn't met for more than a year, so that it can choose a new Supreme Court president according to the seniority system

column1: Netanyahu is keeping a hostage deal as a 'priceless gift' for Trump's return
column7: Netanyahu is keeping a hostage deal as a 'priceless gift' for Trump's return

column1: Gaza medics report 20 Palestinians killed so far Monday; Lebanon rockets hit Israel's north
column2: Police in Jerusalem dismantle protest tents, violently disperse protesters calling for hostage deal ■ Jordan condemns the Allenby Crossing terror attack, emphasizes need for two-state solution ■ Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says that ministers must not enter the Temple Mount/Al Aqsa compound without his approval, asserting that no changes will be made to the site's status
column7: Gaza medics report 20 Palestinians killed so far Monday; Lebanon rockets hit Israel's north
column8: Police in Jerusalem dismantle protest tents, violently disperse protesters calling for hostage deal ■ Jordan condemns the Allenby Crossing terror attack, emphasizes need for two-state solution ■ Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says that ministers must not enter the Temple Mount/Al Aqsa compound without his approval, asserting that no changes will be made to the site's status

column1: In America and Israel, Hamas has successfully turned Jews against each other
column2: After the murder of six Israeli hostages, the blame game between right and left has accelerated, while the disconnect between U.S. and Israeli Jews deepens. It's a victory for Hamas

column1: Israel's Justice Minister expected to delay appointment of new Supreme Court president
column2: He won't be a good boy and accept the ruling quietly,' one person close to Justice Minister Yariv Levin said, referring to the Supreme Court's ruling that he must appoint a new president, 'but he also won't violate it'
column7: Israel's Justice Minister expected to delay appointment of new Supreme Court president
column8: He won't be a good boy and accept the ruling quietly,' one person close to Justice Minister Yariv Levin said, referring to the Supreme Court's ruling that he must appoint a new president, 'but he also won't violate it'

column1: They fought for Hersh Goldberg-Polin and Ori Danino. At the shivah, they met the families
column2: Personal acquaintance was not a precondition for people coming to the homes of the Danino and Goldberg-Polin families, who were sitting shivah last week a few miles from each other. 'I came to console and to be consoled a bit,' said one person who visited both

column1: Netanyahu's own words reveal his failure
column2: Netanyahu's claim – that Hamas alone is stopping a deal – is a testament to the failure of his strategy, if there even was a strategy in the first place

column1: Will Trump or Harris win? Either way, Europe is in for a surprise
column2: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are miles apart on defense issues such as NATO and Ukraine, but Europe could still face a trade war with the U.S. no matter who wins on November 5. Whoever follows Biden 'will care a little less about Europe,' says one expert
